intro: Arabis aschersonii, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and often appear in clusters near the base of the plant. Arabis aschersonii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
